characters: EXT/INT. BIG PIG FOOD TRUCK/ OUTDOOR MOVIE
YOU'RE THE REASON I GOT FAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude. She’s totally doing him!

dialogues.speaker: COURTNEY
dialogues.text: No way. That’s just a rumor.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: How dare you question the sage insights of US Weekly? Molly frisbees an US WEEKLY at Courtney. It features a SNAPSHOT of Jules and Evan holding coffee cups with the headline - “SECRET COUPLE OFF THE DANCE FLOOR?” Rosie buttons her CHEF JACKET, grabs her bag as she watch Evan and Jules dancing on TV -

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Maybe they’re really in love. (then, as she exits) Don’t wait up.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (calling after) Bring us leftovers!

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: (calling back) Pay your rent! We DISSOLVE from the TV, BACK TO THE STUDIO Jules whips open her skirt and uses it as a Pasa Doble ca Evan grabs the skirt and throws it to the JUDGES’ TABLE. audience eats it up. As we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL OUT FROM ANOTHER TV screen, in a different living ro where a couple - TRISH and COLIN COOPER (30s, in matching Snuggies) - watch with laser focus.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Look. Jules is really doing it!

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, but she has to score all tens to beat Tom Brady. He did a flip! We move from the TV, BACK TO THE STUDIO Where Jules and Evan pull out all the stops, including a little audience participation.  4. They playfully sit on the laps of a couple in the front r an OLDER HUSBAND (60) in a Tommy Bahama shirt and his YOU PRETTY WIFE (30). As Jules and Evan dance off for their final sequence of moves, the Young Wife beams to her husband.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WIFE
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you flew us out for this!

dialogues.speaker: OLDER HUSBAND
dialogues.text: Anytime, Tater Tot. BACK ON THE DANCE FLOOR, Evan and Jules bring it all home with some modern moves, even a little hip-hop, as we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL OUT FROM THE TV of a THIRD LIVING ROOM (a modest ren house) where HOLLY BOWEN (Caucasian, more creative than corporate) is on the couch with her LAPTOP as her husband NATE BOWEN (30, African-American, total guy’s guy) takes step into the living room -

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What are you watching?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Celebrity Dance -

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: - Nope. - And exits the hell outta there. Holly laughs, CRANKS TH VOLUME to torture Nate as he walks away. And we -

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE BACK TO THE STUDIO
dialogues.text: Where Evan spins Jules in a final, harrowing lift, then d her into a split as the music ends with a dramatic punch. THE AUDIENCE JUMPS UP, a STANDING OVATION. Jules and Evan hug, soaking up the love.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH DAVIS
dialogues.text: Whoa. Even I need a cold shower after that one. I dunno, folks, did Tom Brady just get sacked? Let’s see what our judges have to say. Hutch turns Jules and Evan to the JUDGE’S TABLE, where a DANCE EXPERTS weigh in.  ANDRE (30s , a hyperbolic queen who can barely stay in his seat) starts off -

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE ANDRE
dialogues.text: Jules, darling. When you started this season, you had the heart of a competitor, but the feet of a school girl in need of corrective shoes. I never expected to see you in the finals. But you stubborn little minx, you. You fought for it, and tonight, you were a vixen, making a meal out of your man out there! This place needs a new roof - because you two just blew it off! Two words: Dance. Gasm! Everyone cheers as the next judge, KELLY (30s), nods.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE KELLY
dialogues.text: Exactly! Jules, on your show, you inspire people to lose weight and change their lives. But it’s just as inspiring to see you challenge yourself. And it doesn’t hurt that you met your match in Evan there. (Jules and Evan smile) You two are peaking at just the right moment! More cheers as the final judge, DALTON (60s, stuffy) shru

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE DALTON
dialogues.text: Frankly, I found the whole thing to be a bit vulgar. It’s like I was practically in the bedroom with you two. The audience BOOS. Jules and Evan share a quick glance. Jules and scorecard.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH DAVIS
dialogues.text: OK, Judges, let’s see those scores -

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE ANDRE
dialogues.text: holds up his score card ip

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE KELLY
dialogues.text: (holds up her score card) Ten! Evan jump and hug- As Dalton holds up his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight. Jules and Evan deflate a little.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH DAVIS
dialogues.text: Ooh, this one’s gonna be close!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TROPHY in shape of dancing feet gets ceremoniously lowe onto the dance floor. All three finalist couples hold hands under their spotlig Tom Brady and his girl. Missy and her guy. Jules and Evan

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH DAVIS
dialogues.text: OK, we have tallied all your scores. The call-in votes combined with the judges’ scores. And... Tom Brady catches Jules's eye. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: TOM BRADY
dialogues.text: Hey. Great stuff out there.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Thanks. You too. Nice flip. Tom shrugs - I try. As Jules turns and whispers to Evan -

dialogues.speaker: JULES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C'mon. He’s already got three Superbowl Rings and Gisele. Isn’t that enough for one lifetime?

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Just Gisele is enough.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH DAVIS
dialogues.text: And the winner of Celebrity Dance Off, Season 15, is... A dramatic pause. Jules suddenly goes pale. Panic-whisper

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Evan. I feel sick!

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH DAVIS
dialogues.text: ..-Jules Baxter and Evan Webb!  ‘Ee FIREWORKS exploded around the stage and the audience chee Evan grabs Jules, picks her up and spins her around as he fellow contestants congratulate them - Jules's POV - a woozy blur of lights and cheering people. Hutch Davis hands her the dancing feet trophy. Jules takes one look at it... And then, PUKES all over it EVERYONE GASPS. It’s LIVE TV. HUTCH DAVIS (CONT’D) Uh, Jules? You OK? (then, a nervous laugh) Heh-heh. Hope she’s not pregnant. Jules and Evan suddenly share a surprised, but knowing lo Sheer panic in both their eyes. And we CUT TO BLACK. TITLE: WHAT TO EXPECT WHEN YOU'RE EXPECTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH! A CAMERA takes a photo of Trish (one half of our Snuggie couple). She’s tidy, always with a nervous smile. The photographer (the other half of our Snuggie couple) i her husband, Colin, rocking khakis and a polo.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Hi everyone! Trish sits before a small assembly of TODDLERS, holding h children’s book: Milk It! There are a few BREAST-FEEDING MOMS, a couple of RELUCTANT DADS. Discreetly checking fan scores on their phones. Signage tells us we’re in a store: THE BREAST CHOICE - a mecca of breast-feeding classes and supplies. TRISH (CONT’D) Welcome to the Breast Choice. I’m Trish Cooper, wearing two hats today as store owner and author of my new children’s book, “Milk It!” (Trish opens the book.) OK, so, let’s dig in... (reading) Goats do it... An illustration shows a GOAT NURSING. She turns the page.  TRISH (CONT’D) Cows do it... (turns the page) Kitty cats do it. (turns the page) Even dolphins in the sea do it. A TODDLER BOY lays down, kicks his legs on the floor. TRISH (CONT’D) Animals all over the world do it. (turns the page) And yes: even YOUR mommy does it When your mommy uses her breast to feed a baby, she is feeding her baby the best. Breast is BEST! A caffeinated TEENAGE BOY pops his head into the store -

dialogues.speaker: TITS
dialogues.text: - And tears off, laughing. Trish gives a pleading look to Colin who haltingly TAKES OFF after him, out of the store

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (beat, smile) OK, I’d like to open up the floor for questions or comments or... Nothing. Finally -

dialogues.speaker: 4-YEAR-OLD BOY
dialogues.text: Are Shrek and The Hulk brothers?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (pauses, smiles) Maybe. We’re all related in some way, right? (again, nothing) Well, thanks everyone for coming. And give your mommy a big hug for breast-feeding you. You now have a head start on a very healthy life! Colin re-enters the store and joins Trish as the reading breaks up. He gives her a peck on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Great job, Hon —

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: - Did you get him?  10 ll

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Naw. Too fast. But I yelled a few choice words. Very choice.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Next time, get him.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Hey. What’s important right now?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (softens) That I just had my first reading?

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Exactly. (beat) Now, I gotta head back to work. A certain Lil’ Wayne is waiting. It’s my first grill! Colin runs his finger over his upper teeth. JUST THEN - we hear a Marimba Chime. Trish and Colin both check their synchronized IPHONES. A PHONE APP WITH A PINK CALENDAR informs them -"“You_are now ovulating.” Trish gi Colin a hungry look -

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Please? We’ll be super fast. Colin sighs, fine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JARS OF NIPPLE CREAM rock on a shelf as Colin and Trish g it in a tiny stock room crammed with product. It’s not th best sex, but Trish is determined.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Yeah, give it to me... C’mon twins - or any number would be great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trish’s employee JANICE (20s, boho, probably breast fed u last week) hears the stockroom action and CRANKS THE VOLU on a SLEEP SHEEP, drowning them out with AMBIENT WAVES. 10 ll  12 13 14 10. INT. STOCK ROOM — DAY 12 A jar of nipple cream falls and nails Colin in the head.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Oh! Are you OK? Colin nods, but slows. The mood quickly fading... annnd g

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Sorry, Squeaks, I just -

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: - No, don't apologize! Negative thoughts can affect reproduction.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: But I’m really trying. I lost the weight, switched my underwear, quit riding my bike.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I know. And I love you for that!

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: I’m just not clutch. I don’t perform under pressure. (beat) And I miss... us.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (a little gasp) Oh no! We’re snuffing out the flame?

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Maybe?... A little?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin, headed back to work, steps onto the elevator as Na Bowen (our “guy’s-guy” husband) steps off. Nate’s look is business casual, cool kicks. He gives Colin a ‘What's up? nod as he exits. EXT. NATE AND HOLLY’S HOUSE - LATE AFTERNOON 14 A CAR skids to a park in the driveway of a run-down house Holly Bowen hops out, juggling her LAPTOP and FABRIC SWAT as she runs inside -  15 16 ply?) 18 i...

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Shit shit shit. INT. NATE AND HOLLY’S HOUSE - DAY 15 Holly runs in the house, down the hall -

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Sorry! We had a huge living room install and they kept changing the furniture placement. She opens the door to find her husband Nate in his home 1 office/ music studio. Tinkering on his KEYBOARD -

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Just waitin’ on my lay-day/ Gonna get our Ethiopian bay-bay... She laughs as her gaze falls on a wall of FRAMED ALBUM CO - everything from classic jazz to rock to hip-hop. Her eyes zero in on 2 LIVE CREW’S classic, “Nasty As They Wanna Be.” Featuring a graphic photo of FOUR BARE-ASSED LADIES bending over. Holly yanks it off the wall -

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aw c’mon. That album represents a very important parenting milestone in my life. It was the first thing I bought just to piss off my mom.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: They’re a Christian organization, Nate. I don’t want to offend them. Holly stuffs the graphic cover in a hall closet as she pa a MIRROR and spots her shoulder in her SLEEVELESS TOP.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit. My tattoo. Holly pulls off her shirt as she turns into -

dialogues.speaker: THE MASTER BEDROOM 18
dialogues.text: Nate follows her, enjoying the view of his shirtless wife

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: So? You’re not gonna be the only mom out there with that Spring Break dolphin. Trust me.  19 12.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but those moms aren’t getting judged like me. (changing shirts) The sad thing is, I wasn’t even drunk when I got this. I thought “Ooh, I’1l never get tired of dolphins.” She slips on a CONSERVATIVE SHIRT.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I haven't gotten tired of it. I smile every time I see it. He slaps her ass as she exits to -

dialogues.speaker: THE LIVING ROOM 19
dialogues.text: Holly does a final zhush of the room - fluffing pillows, She grabs a FRAMED PHOTO off a side table, goes to hide i under the couch. But Nate intercepts it.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No. Not the wedding picture. It’s a classic.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I know, but it’s not for everyone.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Just chill, OK? You were meant to do this.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: (under her breath) If that were true, I’d already be pregnant. The DOORBELL RINGS. They suddenly stop. Share a quick kis

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Love you. Don’t screw it up. Nate goes to the door as Holly stuffs the wedding photo u the couch. The SOCIAL WORKER (40s, sweater set) greets Na

dialogues.speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
dialogues.text: Hi there. I’m Diane Carter from Christian World Adoption.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Nate and Holly Bowen. Come on in.  13. She enters, they exchange polite handshakes as she looks around. The place is modest, but decorated with style.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: This is just a rental. We’re looking to buy right now. Nate throws Holly a look - We are? Holly nods.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We’ll be settled in before the baby even comes.

dialogues.speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. You’ve already passed the fingerprints and background check. This is just for us to get to know you better. 20 INT. NATE AND HOLLY’S HOUSE - HALLWAY - EVENING 20 Nate and Holly give the Social Worker the walk through.

dialogues.speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
dialogues.text: ..-And why did you choose Ethiopia?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Holly wanted to get back to her roots. The Social Worker laughs. Holly shoots Nate a look.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: We love the culture, actually.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Plus all the white babies were taken. This Social Worker doesn’t laugh. Holly punches Nate. He recomposes, tries to act respectable as he points out - NATE (CONT’D) (in the bedroom) OK, so. Smoke detector there. (points to the kitchen) Fire extinguisher there.

dialogues.speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
dialogues.text: Good. You did your homework.  21 14. Nate opens the door to his office/music room. The Social Worker peeks in, looks at all the old vinyl, mixing table etc. Past the wall of framed albums - with a gaping hole. SOCIAL WORKER (CONT’D) You’re a musician?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: In my mind, yes. Actually, I do music licensing for an ad agency here in Atlanta.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: He picks the songs for commercials. The Social Worker nods, jotting notes.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Holly’s an interior designer. She did this whole place.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I just got in with a big firm. It’s a huge opportunity to grow. The Social Worker nods, makes more notes.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. NATE AND HOLLY’S LIVING ROOM - LATER aa Nate and Holly sit on the couch across from the Social Wo as she finishes up their paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
dialogues.text: OK, so here’s how this works. I’11 turn in your home study report, the agency will review it, then start the adoption process. Including matching you with your child.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Right. The referral.

dialogues.speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
dialogues.text: Exactly. And that can take up to six months. Then another six to nine months for the home country to process everything. Nate nods, paying close attention to the time line.  22 15.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: So, we’re talking at least a full year before we become parents?

dialogues.speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
dialogues.text: Every case has its own time line. You just have to be patient.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: So, wait. Does this mean we passed? The Social Worker looks over their application packet.

dialogues.speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
dialogues.text: Well, I don’t see any red flags. (then) Oh, but do you have a wedding picture? We really like to include that in your packet. Holly shakes her head, no. But Nate pulls the photo out f under the couch and hands it to the Social Worker. CLOSE ON: THE PHOTO - NATE AND HOLLY IN COSTUME, shit-fac with a bottle of Jack, and an ELVIS IMPERSONATOR OFFICIAN

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Vegas. It was a costume wedding. I was Shaft, Holly was a showgirl. The picture is funny, but doesn’t scream parents of the y The Social Worker studies it a beat, then hands it back.

dialogues.speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
dialogues.text: You know what? We’1ll just say this got lost. Burned in a fire. EXT. NATE AND HOLLY’S HOUSE - DOORWAY - NIGHT 22 Nate and Holly wave as the Social Worker drives away. Nat lets out a sigh, almost like he’s psyching himself up.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: OK, so we've got a year. That gives us some time to save and get ready.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: What do you mean? We’re ready now. Holly is. But Nate’s not so convinced as we PAN UP to the NIGHT SKY, and...  23 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s OUTDOOR MOVIE NIGHT in the lush park backed by the Atlanta skyline. Lots of date-night couples. Including Colin and Trish who lay out their blanket.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: What’s the movie?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Bladerunner.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Ooh, another surprise. I love you even more. Colin kicks off his loafers as Trish pulls a bottle of WI from their ergonomic wine carrier and two glasses. Colin gives her a look as he pops the cork and pours.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Trish? You sure? You haven’t a had a glass in two years. Trish nods. This is not easy for her, but she smiles -

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I'd like to propose a toast. To taking a break from trying and just... being us for a while.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: (so relieved) OK. I’11 drink to that - He goes to clink glasses, but Trish pulls hers back.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: - And if that doesn’t work, then we'll do three rounds of IVF. (then) And if that doesn’t work, we’1l adopt, which is great because I have no fears - genetic or otherwise! So, to us! (beat, tight smile) I don’t want to lose the flame.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: To the flame. They clink and sip. Trish guzzles that first sip. Then -  24 Nh.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Say. Pinot Grigio is refreshing. As Colin scouts - A ROW OF NEARBY GOURMET FOOD TRUCKS. His eyes landing on “THE BIG PIG” - a pink truck with a snout and curly tail specializing in a menu of gourmet pork. An eager line is already waiting.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Ooh! The Big Pig is here! I didn’t even get a Tweet. (slipping on his loafers) Squeaks, you want anything?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Surprise me. Colin nods and run-walks his way to the Big Pig line. We move up the line to -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRUCK WINDOW. Chef MARCO SUAREZ (23, a playful troublemaker with the looks to get away with it) works wi three-man CREW. A fast, furious, all-hands-on-deck operat

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Let’s go, people. We gotta get y'all fed before the movie starts. Cause if you miss seeing Darryl Hannah’s ass, that’s on me. An EAGER PATRON steps up.

dialogues.speaker: EAGER PATRON
dialogues.text: I'll take three carnitas tacos and two of those jalapeno fritters.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Good man. (then) You have your cardiologist on speed dial, right? The guy smiles as Marco flirts with 2 HOT GIRLS walking b

dialogues.speaker: MARCO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ladies. Best meal on wheels, right here. 24  25 18. One of the girls smiles back, holding up her SANDWICH.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE GIRL
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Tell that to my cheese and bacon panini. Total foodgasm. She nods to a nearby GRILLED CHEESE TRUCK aka ‘THE MELTDO that’s gathering an enthusiastic crowd of its own. Marco looks over, his eyes narrowing. Then he JUMPS throu the window of his truck, abandoning his post. J.J. (20s), Marco's misfit co-worker, calls after him - J.d. Yo, Chef. Where’re you going?

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Back in two secs, J.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chef Rosie Brennen (from the girls’ apartment), effortles beautiful, her hair in braids, works on the Cheese Truck. She wields her knife with skill - slicing peaches and bac when suddenly Marco is at her window, staring her down.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: What do you think you're doing? Rosie gives him a look. Then keeps chopping.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: There’s a line if you want to order -

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: - The only thing I’m ordering is for you to stop serving that bacon. Pig is our turf.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Your “turf?” What is this, West Side Story? Are we gonna rumble at midnight?

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Maybe. I got a whole gang of back-up dancers ready to go. (then) You're the cheese truck. Stick to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That’s funny, because I noticed those jalapeno fritters you’re serving -

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: - Are awesome, right? My invention -

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: - Have ricotta cheese in them.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Oh, c’mon, just a pinch. That’s nothing compared to the bacon crutch you’re propping these sandwiches up on.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Paninis. Blue cheese and grilled peach paninis - with a dash of bacon. Also awesome. My invention.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Fine. You wanna go? Let’s go. Your special against mine - whoever sells the most tonight, wins. (beat) If I win, you have to have a drink with me. And if you win, you may also have a drink with me.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Right. So you can stand me up again? I'll pass. 19. Marco stops, gives her a slow smile. Taunting, flirtaciou

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Wow. That was like five years ago. I can’t believe you still remember.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: It’s not like it keeps me up nights. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: (walking away) Good to see you too, Rosie.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Prepare for battle, Marco! Rosie’s FEMALE CO-WORKER (30, probably eats a lot of cheese) looks over -— grilled  26 27 28 20.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: You know that guy?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: We went to high school together. He’s a total player.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: (watching Marco go) Yeah... I’d play with that. TIME LAPSE - as the lines move through the two trucks, th food teams work hard, putting out food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty bottle of wine rolling on a blanket as Colin and Trish sort of watch the movie. Colin’s feeling good. He casually walks his hand up Trish skirt. She whispers, faux scandalized -

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: But, Dr. Cooper. We’re in public.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: I know. It’s all so unscheduled... He gives her little growl. Trish growls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosie SLAMS the heavy back door of the idling cheese truc The truck pulls away to reveal - Marco on the other side - with TWO COLD BEERS and a smile

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: I win. His chef knives slung over his shoulder. The same ones Ro has slung over her shoulder. She sighs.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 29 21. EXT. PIEDMONT PARKING LOT/ ROSIE’S SHITTY DODGE NEON - NI Rosie and Marco sit on the hood of her battered DODGE NEO his BIKE leaned against the car. The iPod on her dash provides the soundtrack to their conversation.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: ---It’s true. I had a mad crush on you back in the day.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Oh, so that’s why you asked two girls to prom?

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: I asked Mia, but then you broke up with that Lacrosse dude, so I had to make my move -—

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: - While also keeping your options open. Nice.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Hey. I’m not saying it worked.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it. I blocked out most of high school, anyway. She waves her hand, revealing a BANDAGE on her wrist. Mar takes her wrist, looks at it -

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Hey. Where’d you get this?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Oh, that. Yeah, I fought a grill and the grill won.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: “Chef hands." Occupational hazard.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Totally. They’re a real guy magnet. Marco holds up his hand, proudly shows off a scar.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: My first Cog Au Vin. Five stitches.  30 22.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Five? That’s adorable. (then, shows another scar) Deli slicer. Nearly took my thumb.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: (re: a scar on his arm) Second degree burn from a double- boiler. Making caramel.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Mmm. Home-made caramel’s the best.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Never again.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: (showing another scar) This one. Julienning shallots.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: (showing another scar) Julianne. Ex-girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: You probably deserved it.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: So mean. Are you always this mean? She smiles and nods. Marco give her a look. A moment betw them. Rosie considers him, then lets out a decisive sigh.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: OK, Trouble. I’m gonna go. She slides off the hood. Marco gives her a look, then hop off too. He makes a show of opening the car door for her.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Well, Rosie Brennen, it was good catching up. Maybe I’11 see ya on the truck line again sometime. Marco formally holds out his hand. Rosie shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: If you‘re lucky. She lets go, turns to get in her car. But then, Rosie tur back to him and suddenly they’re KISSING. SMASH TO: Rosie and Marco making out against the car, all chemistry midnight madness. Talking between kisses -  31 32 33 23..

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: OK, seriously, I’m going... (more kissing) This is me getting in my car...

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: (more kissing) This is me waving goodbye... LATER. Rosie’s Dodge Neon now rocks in the near-empty par lot. Her bare feet peek out an open window. Marco’s bike over, setting off Rosie’s CAR ALARM, as...

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE PARKING LOT 32
dialogues.text: Trish and Colin tip-toe out of a wooded park area, wrappe their picnic blanket. He picks a leaf from her hair. Then

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Is that our alarm? And from the blinking RED TAIL LIGHTS of Rosie’s car to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun streams in. The (now clean) Celebrity Dance Off trophy sits on a night stand, next to a copy of the book WHAT TO EXPECT WHEN YOU’RE EXPECTING. A hand reaches for a pair of EYEGLASSES. They slip onto t face of Evan as his gaze focuses on Jules, already up and stretching. He watches her from bed, enjoying the view. She’s not showing yet, but her boobs look bigger. He smil

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: C'mon. Let me see ‘em. Jules sighs, then flashes Evan her new boobs. He smiles, gives an appreciative slow-clap.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Never gets old. Jules drops her shirt and continues stretching.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: You sure you’re not freaking out? You can say so. I can take it.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Freak out’s a little strong.  34 24.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I just don’t want you to feel trapped. I really thought I had a bad fallopian tube. Honestly, if you don’t think you can handle it - that’s fine - let’s not force it. Evan reaches out and pulls Jules back to bed with him.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Hey, Idiot. I wanted to be with you before you were pregnant. This just speeds things up a bit.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: A lot.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: So? We’re old enough, we love each other, we can afford it, what’s to figure out? He smiles, kisses her. Then -

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s not like it changes who we are.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Exactly. So, what are you gonna do about your show?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: New season starts in three weeks, and we’ll be wrapped before I have to deliver. (beat, smile) I’m gonna help people get thin while I get fat. Evan laughs. Jules gives him a last kiss, gets out of bed flashes her boobs one last time before heading to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: DAY 34
dialogues.text: A pristine 1920’s house in historic Little Five Points. Lots of character. A FOR SALE SIGN in the yard.  35 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, wood floors, beautiful old windows - the kind of place you buy and live in forever. COUPLES linger, taking it in. Including Nate and Holly, w is already decorating it in her mind.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: This is it. This is the one.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What?! No. We’re not buying. We’re just looking.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: But can’t you picture it? The couch here, you and your keyboard over there, singing at our Christmas party. Nate mimes playing the keys as he makes up a goofy song -

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Are you effin crazy?/ First, we gotta deal with the baby/ Then we can talk house, my lovely spouse - Holly starts defiantly singing her own song, Edward Sharp and the Magnetic Zero’s “Home.”

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Home, let me come home home home -

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: - Oh no, uh-uh. You’re not allowed to use that song against me. I’m the one who put it on your iPod.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I know. It’s a good one.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’m trying to get it placed in our United Airlines ad. Holly nods, then catches another COUPLE seriously checkin out the house. She gives them a territorial stare.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Nate. This is the one.  36 37 26.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: We're just looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Food Trucks set up for the lunch rush outside an office p At the Big Pig Truck, Marco chats up some FLIRTY OFFICE GIRLS. As they walk away, smiling Marco turns and catches Rosie watching him. She looks away. Pretending not to car

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Rosie, hey. ‘Sup? We should totally “catch up” again. Soon.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Uh, I dunno, Marco. I think we did it, I think we’re all “caught up.” Rosie gets back to work. Marco playfully calls after her

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Aw, you know this isn’t over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trish is crashed out in a private lactation room, curled with two giant pregnancy pillows.

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: Trish? You OK? She slowly opens an eye, DROOL runs down her face. The pillows have huge drool pools on them.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (groggily, pats her belly) What?... Oh... I was dreaming I grew a kangaroo pouch. Do I have a kangaroo pouch?

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: No. But that sounds awesome.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: It was. I didn’t need a purse anymore. I kept my snacks in there - Trish suddenly stops. Her eyes POP open, realizing...  38 39

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand reaches for a PREGNANCY TEST. Pull back to reveal Rosie holding it. As a PAINFULLY YOUNG TEENAGE COUPLE (maybe 16, in matchin black hoodies and skinny jeans) hold the same test. The T Girl gives Rosie a knowing look as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin, wearing a swim-cap, goggles and a surf shirt, methodically swims laps. Trish, PREGNANCY TEST in hand, frantically fast-walks pas ‘NO RUNNING’ SIGN to catch up alongside him.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Hey, Colin. Colin. Sweetie. Colin, oblivious, FLIP-TURNS at the end of the lap. Trish stays with him, trying to get his attention. Getting loud

dialogues.speaker: TRISH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Colin! COLIN! Unable to get his attention. Trish finally launches herse INTO THE POOL, attacking him like a wet labrador.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: (under attack) Argghhh! Trish! Good god, you know I’m on Lipitor!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (scary scream) I'm pregnant!

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: You're... what? Trish waves the pregnancy test.

dialogues.speaker: WITH CHILD
dialogues.text: A beat. Then —-

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: I did it! I preggoed you! Trish and Colin jump up and down in the pool, hugging. Tr suddenly looks rather turned on, starts to make out with  40 28. The LIFEGUARD blows his whistle as the pregnancy test flo into the lane of an UPTIGHT GUY swimming laps. He tries t splash the pregnancy test back to Trish and Colin.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER SWIMMER
dialogues.text: Ew. Keep it in your lane, people. INT. ROSIE’S APARTMENT - BATHROOM - DAY 40 BRAS and TIGHTS hang from the shower curtain rod. MAGAZIN are scattered across the vanity, including a LIFE & STYLE cover of Jules and Evan kissing with the headline - “TOGE AND PREGNANT!” As Rosie sits on the toilet staring at TWO POSITIVE PREGN TESTS.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: s+ SHLts

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (pounding on the door) Rosie! Hurry up. I have to get ready for my interview.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Sorry. Coming. Rosie flushes, quickly stuffs the pregnancy evidence in a drawer and OPENS the door as her two roommates - Molly and Courtney stumble in. Molly grabs her purple bra from the curtain rod and slips it on under her shirt.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: God, this is depressing. I worked at Urban Outfitters my senior year. Now I have to go crawling back. (beat) Thanks for nothing, college degree.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Olive Garden fell through, huh?

dialogues.speaker: COURTNEY
dialogues.text: Aw, Molls. We were really looking forward to those free bread sticks.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. I still have that pervy manager at Outback who loves me. He’ll hook us up with free drinks and apps during happy hour.  41 42 29,.

dialogues.speaker: COURTNEY
dialogues.text: Sounds like dinner. Rosie, you in?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Because all my life needs right now is a free Mai Tai and some coconut shrimp. Rosie walks to her bedroom and shuts the door. Courtney a Molly share a look.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: What the hell? I thought she finally got laid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin and Trish stand at the DOOR of an imposing estate. Trish's breasts look like they’ve grown three cup sizes s the last scene. She helps psyche Colin up.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Don’t let him get into your head.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Not today. He can’t ruin this. Trish nods in solidarity, then THROWS UP in a BUSH. Colin makes a gross face, then gently rubs her back, as -— COLIN (PRE-LAP) (CONT’D) So, Dad, Trish and I have a little announcement to make...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON: Colin and Trish sitting at an outdoor table wit brunch. A lush back yard and pool behind them. Right on a pristine GOLF COURSE.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH AND COLIN
dialogues.text: We’re pregnant! REVERSE ON: the other side of the table, where the OLDER YOUNG WIFE couple we saw in The Celebrity Dance Off audie now sit.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WIFE
dialogues.text: Oh my god! So are we!  30. This is RAMSEY COOPER (60, a robust rascal, always in Tom Bahama) and his third-wife, SKYLER COOPER (30, as sweet a she is pretty). There’s a long beat as everyone processes the weird news. Then Ramsey beams.

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY
dialogues.text: Well hell. I guess this means congratulations to all of us. Skyler and Trish exchange polite smiles. Colin just stare

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Uh, wow, Dad. I had no idea you and Skyler were even trying.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: We wanted to keep it quiet, in case it didn’t work.

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY
dialogues.text: But first time’s a charm.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Actually, third time’s a charm. The saying is “third time’s -”

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY
dialogues.text: - Not for us. First time got ‘er done. But y’all have been at ita while now, huh? Coupla years? Trish swallows, forces a smile. Colin sighs.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Not everything’s a race, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY
dialogues.text: Not everything. Just most things. (a smile, then) Aw, c’mon Col, let’s celebrate. Let’s go to Margaritaville.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: I don’t want to go to Margaritaville, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY
dialogues.text: Everybody wants to go to Margaritaville. Ramsey aims a REMOTE at -  31. AN INDOOR/ OUTDOOR MARGARITAVILLE BAR, complete with SIGN An expensive backyard shrine to Jimmy Buffet. Lights come and Margaritaville Music begins to play -

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I‘1ll break out the Don Julio Blanco.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: It’s 11 am. I’m not doing shots.

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY
dialogues.text: Okey-doke. More for me. Ramsey dances off to his bar to get his shot. Skyler smil

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Trish, I’m so glad I have a baby expert in the family. Do you feel anything yet?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Just joy. And maybe a little nausea, plus some exhaustion, and I have to pee every five - (catching herself, smiles) - But I’m so happy! Every symptom is just proof that a miracle is happening inside me!

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Yeah, I thought I’d have to give up tennis and running, but so far, I just have all this extra energy. Trish looks at Skyler - the girl is stunning. Trish digs fingernails into her hands as she smiles and nods.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Plus, I’m, like - (an embarrassed whisper) - Crazy-horny. I mean, if I even get a whiff of Ramsey, I have to pounce. I wear this old dog out. Ramsey, returning with his shot, and Skyler share a giggl

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY
dialogues.text: Hormones. What’re you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: I dunno. Maybe not talk about it over brunch? That’s what I’d do.  43 44 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramsey and Skyler walk Colin and Trish to the front door. They pass _a BRAG WALL OF PHOTOS, ARTICLES, MEMENTOS. showcasing Ramsey Cooper’s long, illustrious, NASCAR care

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY
dialogues.text: Well, your step-mom and I really wish y’all could stay longer, but -

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: - Sorry. We have to go by Home Depot. And pick up some mulch.

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY
dialogues.text: OK. But ya know what they say... (digging in his pocket) Money’s not everything, but it sure will keep you connected to your kids. Ramsey pulls out a GIANT MONEY ROLL of hundreds. He tries peel off a few bills for Colin, who refuses.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Dad, no. I don’t need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin drives. Trish reclines in the car seat as far as it goes. Baby Einstein music plays as a worked-up Colin ramb

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Really? He hasn’t done enough parental damage? They haven’t even been married a year! (then) You know what? We won’t let it affect us. You, me and little “Mini Cooper” there will do great.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: “Mini Cooper.” So cute. Colin spots a CUPCAKE BAKERY -

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: You having any cravings? A cupcake, maybe. (Trish looks ill) OK, we'll just get a few. Colin pulls in. Off Trish’s face, looking green, to...  45 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON: Marco also looking ill. PULL OUT TO REVEAL: FOO TRUCKS are lined up at an OFFICE PARK, prepping the lunch rush.. Marco paces. Rosie just stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: You sure you took the test right?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: You pee on a stick. It’s pretty idiot proof.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Right, sorry. I just... shit. Wow. One night, huh?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Congratulations. You have robo-sperm.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: So... What do you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: What do you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: I dunno. I just got the information. I mean, you’re the girl. Don’t you get to decide?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Great, so it’s all on me then?

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: - No. I didn’t mean that, I just... fuck. (then) Should we get married?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: “Fuck. Should we get married?” Well gee, when you put it that way.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Sorry, Rosie. I’m just trying to do the right thing here.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Then don’t ask the wrong questions. (then) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know what? Just forget it. Forget I said anything. I gotta get back to work. Rosie turns to go. Marco moves to go after her, but MARCO BOSS (40s, grizzled) intercepts him - MARCO’S BOSS Chef, let’s go. People gotta eat. INT. INTERIOR DESIGN FIRM - WORK AREA -— DAY 46 Holly eats take-out lunch with her co-worker and friend, (30, warm, chatty) as they sort FABRIC SAMPLES.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: .-. I just wish he was as excited as me, you know? He treats it like some chore I talked him into. (then) I dunno, maybe he’s not ready. Kara stops. Give Holly a look.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Dude’s group.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: It’s like Fight Club - only there’s no fights and the men have babies. (off Holly's look) I don’t know what happens there, I don’t know what they talk about. All I know is Craig started going when I was pregnant with Henri and he was losing his shit. Now he loves being a dad and he never misses a Saturday. (beat) You want Nate ready? Send him to the dudes. Kara scribbles down the details, hands the piece of paper Holly, as... INT. OBSTETRICIAN’S OFFICE - LOS ANGELES - DAY 47 An OBSTETRICIAN hands Jules and Evan a pamphlet on AMNIOCENTESIS as he walks them out of an exam room.  35. Jules carries a PREGNANCY BINDER, already full of researc Lady likes to be informed.

dialogues.speaker: OBSTETRICIAN
dialogues.text: You’re in great health, your blood pressure’s low -

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: - See? Great health. That’s all we need to know. Let’s not go crazy with the research.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: What? I like the research. It soothes me.

dialogues.speaker: OBSTETRICIAN
dialogues.text: Then you’ll love “the wall.” See you two next month. He smiles and exits. As Jules turns to - A WALL OF PAMPHLETS on pregnancy-related topics. Jules si Abhh. As Evan looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: No. I don’t want to know about everything that can go wrong. As Jules starts gathering one of each.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (reading as she grabs) Breast-feeding... Cord-Banking... The Bradley Birthing Method... Circumcision: Yes or No? -

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: - Of course. How is that even a question? A YOUNG NURSE walking past, stops -

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG NURSE
dialogues.text: Actually, a lot of couple are choosing not to circumcise these days. Insurance doesn’t even cover it anymore. She smiles, exits. Jules nods - then adds that pamphlet t the pile. Evan looks at her like she’s a little bit insan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosie, exhausted at the end of her shift, throws her kniv over her shoulder, when someone grabs her hand... Marco. He gives her a look.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Hey. I’m not going to forget it. Rosie sighs, gives a little nod. 49 INT. ROSIE’S APARTMENT —- NIGHT Molly and Courtney watch ‘Lose It’ on TV. 49pt ON SCREEN: Jules (bigger boobs, no belly yet) rides back of a slow-moving PICK-UP TRUCK, yelling at 12 OBESE CONTESTANTS, all pushing the truck across A FOOTBALL FIEL

dialogues.speaker: KEEP PUSHING
dialogues.text: (then) SAY ‘I’M WORTH IT!’

dialogues.speaker: CONTESTANTS, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: I’M WORTH IT!

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: This show makes me so hungry. Rosie opens the front door and enters with Marco. She chu a bag of leftovers to the girls. Their curious gaze is on Marco.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Marco, this is Courtney and Molly. And vice-versa.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: COURTNEY
dialogues.text: Whoa, the Marco?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (nodding with approval) Well done, Rosie. Well. Done.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Ignore her. My room’s over here. Marco follows Rosie to her bedroom. The door opens to rev 48 49 49pt  37. INT. NATE AND HOLLY’S HOUSE - DAY 50 Nate sorting CDs in his office (the 2 Live Crew Album is in place). Holly stands in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: No way. Uh-uh, I am not going to that. I’ve already got friends.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: But these guys all have babies.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I know. That sounds terrible. (catching himself) I mean, I’1l be down with our kid when it’s time, but -

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: - Craig goes. You like Craig.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I like Craig at a barbecue. Not as a forced play date. Nate moves to put on head phones. Then -

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: If you go, just once, I’1l give you a B.J. Right here, right now. Nate stops, puts his headphones down.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: B.J. Blackmail? That’s the card you’re throwin’ down? Holly gives him a coy smile, slowly nods, moving in - NATE (CONT’D) Fine, but a real one. Not one of those where you get half-started, then the phone rings and you wander off and start talking to your mom. Holly puts her hand over his mouth to shut him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saturday morning. People in the park power walk and jog. stands by his car, drinking coffee. When he spots - In dramatic slow-mo - a MOTLEY CREW OF DADS (about 6) all walking towards him. It’s Reservoir Dogs - with strollers The group is headed up by VIC (30s, a gregarious bear of guy), wearing a Baby Bjorn, pushing a double stroller, trailed by a toddler, HASKEL (3, plastic sword, black eye As they get closer, CRAIG (30, perpetually exhausted, pus baby Henri in a stroller) gives Nate a sleepy fist-bump.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Hey Craig.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: (doing the introduction) Nate, Vic. Vic, Nate. vic Welcome to Thunderdome. Let’s walk. Nate cautiously joins the guys as Vic leads them through park, down a trail. He looks over, sizing Nate up -

dialogues.speaker: VIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I sense your fear. It’s cool, you’re still on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Stay there, Nate. Seriously, man. vic Craig's had a rough week. Kara took a three-day business trip. And little Henry there got sick. Vic pulls out a FLASK from his Bjorn, tosses it to Craig.

dialogues.speaker: VIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There you go, big guy. Walk it off.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: (to Nate) Oh, and around Kara, he’s still ‘Henri.’ Let’s keep ‘Henry’ on the DL. vic See, Nate. Woman pretty much control the baby universe. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: vic (CONT'D) And why not? They carried the damn things. But here, we’re free. No one’s looking over your shoulder if you put the diaper on wrong, or don't heat up the bottle. And if your wife names your kid “Henri” and you want to call him “Henry” - go for it. This is a safe place.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Good to know. You look like you've got your hands full there, Vic. vic Yep. I got four under five. Ava, the baby here, Sailor and Stella, the twins, and Haskel the Rascal back there. (turns, yells at Haskel) Yo, Buddy. Keep up! (beat) I mean, sure, twice a year, I think about the price of college and weep in my car. But then I punch myself in the nuts and get over it. (beat, a smile) It’s awful, but it’s so beautiful. Do you have life insurance?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: We've been meaning to. vic I’1l hook you up. You'll need that. Just then, GABE, the portliest, hair-thinningest of the group, spots someone running toward them -

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Whoa. Wait for it... And then, the guys all break into a burly cheer as -

dialogues.speaker: DA-VIS
dialogues.text: DAVIS (36, a rugged alpha male with a great head of hair) comes jogging up. The kind of guy women want, men want to Fist bumps all around. Davis is tan, healthy, unencumbere NOT part of Dude group, but nice enough to say hello.  40.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: What’s up, fellas, offspring - everyone good? Haskel, nice shiner. Vic, did you do that? vic You kidding? I can’t take this guy. That was all his mom. Three rounds. Davis laughs as he hops on a PULL UP BAR, casually talkin he works out. Never out of breath. The guys watching in a

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: So, D, where you been? We haven't seen you around.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
