dialogues.text: Jules's pregnant belly on the cover of a stack of FIT PREGNANCY MAGAZINES that hit the counter. Trish (6 months now, looking worse) grabs a copy and looks at it with Jan Jules looks radiant, but the cover headline is a surprise In huge letters, Jules's cover story reads - “I'm Not Circumcising My Baby.” Off the magazine, we find... EXT. ‘LOSE IT AND WEEP’ SET - LOS ANGELES - DAY 91 Evan stands near his car, holding the MAGAZINE, quietly arguing with Jules - (close to 7 months now) - as the cre and the remaining 6 contestants all watch, whispering.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Jules, just let me have this, OK? 6000 years of tradition, my cultural identity. Why is this such a big deal to you?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Because I don’t think it’s right. And I don’t care if it sounds crazy. I’m his mother.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: And I’m his father. Parenthood is about compromise.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: So, compromise, Evan.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: I have. I’m the one who moved into your house. And I loved my condo.  60.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: What about me? I’m sacrificing my entire body for this!

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: So that means you just get to win every argument? We'll “discuss it”, means Jules just gets her way? (she smiles - sure) No. I’m not that guy. And we’re not going to parent like that. We’re in this together.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Look, Evan. In every relationship there’s an alpha and a beta, and I just think we have our roles confused here. They both stop and look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN JULES
dialogues.text: I’m the alpha. I’m the alpha.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN JULES
dialogues.text: What? No, I’m the alpha! What? No, I’m the alpha!

dialogues.speaker: EVAN JULES
dialogues.text: No, I AM! NO, I AM!

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: You know why we won that competition, Jules? Because you let me lead.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: No. I only let you think you were leading. That’s why we won. They stare each other down a stubborn beat. Then -

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: You know what. I don’t care what you tell some magazine, I still have a say in what happens to my son. I gotta get to rehearsal. Evan tosses the mag back to Jules. Evan get in his car an peels away. Jules sighs. A CAMERA GUY walks past Jules. He has an Australian accen  92 92pt 93 61.

dialogues.speaker: AUSTRALIAN CAMERA GUY
dialogues.text: I didn't get snipped. No one does back home. It’s great. Jules nods, then sees all contestants looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Get on those treadmills! You have a weigh-in tomorrow and someone's going home! And off the Magazine in Jules's hands... Sheryl Crow's co of The First Cut Is The Deepest plays as... INT. NATE AND HOLLY’S HOUSE - EVENING 92 ON TV - Evan spins into frame, waltzing with Wanda on Nat and Holly’s TV. As the Sheryl Crow song finishes playing. Nate, surrounded by tools and STROLLER PARTS (trying and failing to put it together) looks up at Holly. She has he laptop open, updating her portfolio. Nate notices -

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You should go out on your own. (then) I mean, not yet. We can’t afford it. But in a few years. Holly nods, almost says something, but stops when Nate, frustrated with the stroller, chucks the screwdriver.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If this is a parenting test, I failed already. Holly sighs. A NURSERY IMAGE on her website becomes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stack of POST CARDS with a “Holly Bowen Designs” LOGO t Holly hands to Trish, now 6 months pregnant, looking more wrecked.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: --.- So if anyone needs help with a nursery or just getting organized, I can take care of all of that.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Sure. Leave them on the counter.  94 62.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Great. Thank you so much. (looking at Trish's belly) And congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Oh thanks. It’s - (her eyes go wide) - OH! There’s a kick, OK. A moving baby is a healthy baby! Holly’s gaze lingers a beat as Trish suddenly realizes - TRISH (CONT’D) Oh, you wanna...? Trish takes Holly’s hand and places it on her belly. Holl feels a kick. She smiles, then suddenly tears up.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: It really is a miracle, isn’t it? Trish smiles, nods. Then farts. Off Holly’s stifled laugh we pick up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The laughter of partiers out on a Saturday night. They wa in and out of BARS as food trucks serve the late night/ea hangover crowd. In The Meltdown truck, Rosie, detached, keeps her head do chopping some onions as hungry patrons wait. Her co-worke looks back from working the window -

dialogues.speaker: CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: Damn, girl, the grilled Gorgonzola is killing tonight. Rosie just keeps chopping, but looks up briefly out and s The YOUNG TEEN COUPLE from when Rosie got her pregnancy t walk by. Still in their black hoodies and skinny jeans - now the girl has a big pregnant belly. The whole world SLOWS and DISTORTS as Rosie watches the couple - laughing, his hand on her belly. It’s like some blissful postcard from a life Rosie won’t ever have. CO-WORKER (CONT’D) Rosie... Rosie!  95 96 63. Rosie snaps to and looks down to see her hand bleeding al over the onions. She cut herself. Rosie grabs a towel, covers her hand. As ANOTHER CO-WORKE jumps in to pick up the slack.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: Take a break. I got this. Rosie sits on the back bumper of the truck. Across the 95 street, she sees -— Marco and his crew, blasting music from the Pig as they w and flirt with girls. A HOT GIRL dangles a HABANERO PEPPE over J.J.’s mouth as everyone cheers him on.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Don’t do it, bro! A habanero’s not worth the forty bucks! But J.J. swallows the entire hot pepper. Then SCREAMS. Everyone laughs and CHEERS. It’s like a party on that tru Rosie looks back down at her hand, bleeding through the w towel and starts to cry. SOBBING by herself, as MUSIC PLA FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trish, now 7 months, rocks in a glider, her feet on a yog ball, as Janice, laptop open, helps plan her baby shower.

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: (reading) “...So0 let’s shower Trish & Colin Cooper with light and love to honor the arrival of their Mini Cooper.” And then I’1l put a little picture of a Mini Cooper on the Evite.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (chugging some TUMS) That’s beautiful, Janice. I - - Trish looks up and sees an actual MINI COOPER CONVERTIB park outside. And out steps -— Skyler - 7 months pregnant, with the cutest baby bump you ever seen. She wears short-shorts and sexy stiletto boots It’s effortless. She makes her way to the store -—  64.

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: Trish, look away. You don’t need to see this. But too late. Trish struggles to her feet as Skyler enter the store.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I have to. She’s my step-mother-in- law. Janice nods - oooccokay - as Skyler enters the store.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Hi Trish! Wow - look at our bellies. We’re like twins! Skyler moves into frame with Trish, who dwarfs her.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just wanted to stop by and personally invite you to our baby shower. (beat) I know things have always been rocky between Colin and Ramsey, but we're family, and it would mean the world to me if y’all came. She hands Trish a very CHIC BOX. Even the invite is stunn Trish opens the box - it has two MINI COOPER HOT WHEELS C With a note that says - “Mini Coopers on the way!” Trish just stops - that was going to be her shower theme.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Oh. Mini Cooper. So cute! (a smile, then) So, Skyler, seven months now, you feeling OK?

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: I just feel so whole and feminine - with all this life running through me -- oh, what am I saying? Trish, you know how it is. The more Sklyer talks, the more Trish can’t take it.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Of course, I have to get the nursery decorated, but -  65. Trish grabs Holly’s design cards and shoves the whole sta at Skyler -

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: - There you go! Done!

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: See?! You’re such a great resource! Well, can’t wait to see y’all at the shower. Trish and Skyler share and awkward hug over their bellies

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I’11 tell colin. As Skyler walks out, Trish tilts her head, getting a good look at the back of her thighs in short-shorts.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No cellulite. Not even in daylight.

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: I didn’t have legs that good when I was - ever. As Skyler walks to her car, even men who could give a shi about a pregnant lady stop and stare. Janice sighs.

dialogues.speaker: JANICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She’s like a magical pregnancy unicorn. 97 INT. TRISH AND COLIN’S HOUSE - NIGHT 97 Trish, in her Snuggie, shows Colin the invitation. Colin getting fatter, looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Mini Cooper? Colin crumples it up, chucks it in the trash.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No. I’m done competing with him. I won't get sucked in. Colin grabs a cupcake, settles into ‘Lose It And Weep’ on 97pt Where the PERKY HOST stands with Jules and announces final four.  98 66.

dialogues.speaker: PERKY HOST
dialogues.text: And a little heads up America, while we send these four home to train on their own before our live finale, some of our previous season’s contestants are going to get a little surprise.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: That’s right. I’m going to be dropping in on some of you guys to see how you’ve been keeping the weight off. (beat, smile) You have been warned. off the show, we are in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules, 8 months pregnant now, briskly waddles around pack for her trip as Evan looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: They can’t get someone else to fly around and do these interviews? I don’t like you traveling this late.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: No one’s asking you to stop doing your job. These are my contestants, I was with them when they lost that weight. Jules stops, short of breath. This worries Evan.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: You’re pushing yourself too hard. Especially at your age -

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (now pissed) - Thanks, Ry. Big help. Really.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Sorry, what? I’m not supposed to even mention reality?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: My amnio was great and my blood pressure’s low, OK?  67.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Someone should go with you.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I have my crew, but if you want to leave your show and come, you're welcome to. Jules gives Evan a pointed look. Then -

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Fine. I’1l go with you.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Really? You’1ll leave the show?

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just agree to circumcise little Jackson there and I’m in.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: No. I’m not having this conversation again. We already decided.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: No, you decided. That’s not the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: And we're not naming him Jackson. I hate that name.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: You liked it last week.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I changed my mind! I’m allowed to change my mind!

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Well, hey - maybe you’1ll change your mind on circumcision too.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Evan, get out of my room! -

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: - Right. Your room. Your house. Your rules. (then) How about this, Jules. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: EVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why don’t you just make every decision about our child’s entire life and then send me an email when you've figured it all out? Evan walks out of the room. Jules calls after him -

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: And why don’t you go back to your condo and leave me alone! She SLAMS the bedroom door. LOCKS it. Evan stands in the there a beat, but doesn’t try to coax her out.

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: Jules wheels her suitcase through the living room to the front door to go as a sleepy Evan rises from her sofa, ha stayed there all night. Evan gets up, follows her to the door. She stops, they lo at each other a beat. He puts his hand protectively on he belly a beat. Then, quietly -

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: I really don’t want you to go.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Heard you the first time. Jules sighs, opens the door. A TOWN CAR waits outside. Ev tries to help her with her suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Here, let me help you -

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: - I got it.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Right. You can do it all on your own.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 100 INT. ROSIE’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 100 Rosie lays on the couch wearing miss-matched PJs, binging a marathon of “16 and Pregnant.” Molly and Courtney walk  101 102

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: You have to stop watching this. It’s not helping. Rosie just blinks. Turns up the TV.

dialogues.speaker: COURTNEY
dialogues.text: C’mon, Ro, you come home from work and just camp out there. It’s been over a month. Molly gently takes the remote -

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: - No, no, no - it’s the part where Adam leaves Carley at the hospital. - And clicks off the TV. Molly looks at Rosie.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: We got you a surprise.
101 Holly and Nate, also dressed up, walk to the entrance of dive bar. Nate stops at the door, takes Holly’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I realize how much you've been doing, between work and getting everything ready for the baby, and -

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: (suddenly feeling guilty) - Nate, about work. I -

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: - No shop-talk tonight. I just wanna remind you we can still kick it Nate and Holly-style. Nate smiles, pushes open the door and...

dialogues.speaker: SURPRISE
dialogues.text: 102 All their friends and family are there, including the dud walk guys, Nate’s co-workers. And a pile of BABY GIFTS.  103 70.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: (turns to Nate) You set this up?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I had a little help. Kara rushes over with TWO TACKY SOMBREROS (one says ‘Papi one says ‘Mamacita’) and plops them on Nate and Holly’s h

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Happy Dive-Bar, Baby Shower! Nate smiles at Holly. She feels even more guilty. He spot little KARAOKE STAGE, starts rubbing his hands together.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Ooh Kara, you got our jams?

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: You know it, Mr. Bowen.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC KICKS IN AS -
dialogues.text: MONTAGE: NATE AND HOLLY’S KARAOKE BABY SHOWER 103 Drinks get passed, savored. Holly takes two. Nate’s on the stage, killing a cover of the Human League’ Don't You Want Me Baby, sung as Don't You Want A Baby. Ho joins in, making it a duet. More drinks get passed, savored, everyone tipsy. Now Nate and the dude walk guys are on stage singing. Nate and Holly open up their presents, holding up one mus themed onesie after another - RUN DMC, THE BEATLES, etc.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: Dude. Your kid already has cooler taste in music than you do. Vic and his WIFE let loose, dancing. VIC’S WIFE (shit-faced) I LOVE YOU! LET’S HAVE ANOTHER

dialogues.speaker: BABY
dialogues.text: Vic takes away her drink. Everyone onstage continues karaoake-ing to a big, sloppy finish. As dude-walk Gabe falls off and splats on the flo  104 qh. Then silence. Then Patel checks his phone -

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: Man. Is it 9:30 already? Everyone else checks their phones too. vic Oh. We gotta get back to the sitter before ten or she charges us extra. And just like that, this ‘rager’ is over as all these par quickly make their way home before 10PM. Holly and Nate hug Kara -

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Thanks, Ms. K, you did us up right.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: It’s the least we could do, especially since Holly lost her jo - Holly throws her a panicked look. Kara stops. KARA (CONT’D) - I mean, nothing. I was never here. But too late. Nate spins to Holly who meekly offers -

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I’‘ve been meaning to tell you. curt TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate and Holly argue near their car, occasionally stoppin wave as various well-wishers leave their party. But Nate seriously pissed.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You got laid off and you didn’t even tell me!? Who does that!? You'd be the first call I’d make. I would be physically unable of keeping that from you.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I know and I’m sorry. I was trying to get another job before you noticed. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re already so worried about saving and getting ready and the house... I didn’t want to stress you out more. I thought it would all work out. And it will!

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (shakes his head, then) Whatever you need me to do, I do. You wanted me to give up playing in bands, I gave up playing in bands -

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: - That wasn’t for me. You needed a job with a real paycheck.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: But I did it for you, ‘cause we’re in this together. And here I am, trying to get ready for this baby -

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: - Oh my god. I knew it! You’re not even ready.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Look. I’m not like you, OK? I can’t just look at a picture and feel some magical bond. We don’t even know his medical history.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: So? All of parenthood is a risk, Nate. ALL OF IT.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, well and it’s even riskier when you’re lying to me like this.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Nate. I... (breaking down) just couldn’t handle another thing being my fault, OK? I’m the one with the gimpy womb. I’m the one who made us spend the 401k money on IVF. I’m the one who’s making us spend twenty-three grand on an adoption you don’t even want!

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Whoa - hey. I never said that.  105 73.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Well. Not out loud. Holly looks away. Nate suddenly gets quiet. They sit there in silence several beats. Holly looks up a Craig, crossing to his car, shaking his head at her.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you didn’t tell him.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Oh, glass houses, Craig. I know all about how you call your son “Henry” when Kara’s not around.

dialogues.speaker: KARA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You what!? They all turn to see Kara standing there. Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Hon. I told you to wait out front. I’m bringing the car around.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: You... don’t like the name Henri? Kara turns and storms off. Now Craig looks at Nate, pisse then chases after his wife. Nate sighs. Gives Holly a look.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: We’re not buying that house.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Yes we are. I am not bringing my baby home to a crappy rental. They both get in their car and SLAM the door. Neither one ready to budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trio of BEERS dance through a crowded audience as Molly elbows her way to the front of the stage where Courtney a Rosie are camped out. Molly passes out beers to the girls Rosie’s trying to get into it, but struggling.  74.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (toasting) To us. They clink and drink.

dialogues.speaker: COURTNEY
dialogues.text: To ignoring every guy in this room. They clink and drink. Then Rosie meekly offers.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: To leaving the house in something other than stained pajama pants. Clink and drink. Rosie tries to smile.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks for the tickets.

dialogues.speaker: COURNTEY
dialogues.text: Of course. Arcade Fire’s your favorite band, we had to. (then) Plus, Molls here paid actual money for the tickets. No sexual favors were exchanged for this night out.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Though I did get raped by Ticket Master, so I still go home a winner. Rosie laughs a little. Courtney and Molly dance to the ho music. Rosie looks around the crowd and suddenly spots... Marco, there with J.J. and some FRIENDS. Across the chaot crowd, Rosie and Marco just stare at each other for a pai beat. Marco starts to move and Rosie ducks away and -

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Uh, I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Want me to come with? Rosie shakes her head no, already cutting through the cro to get some air.  106 Ta).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosie pushes out the doors to the lobby, stops and catche her breath. She looks across just as Marco pushes out the other set of lobby doors. He walks over -

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Rosie.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Oh hey, Marco, I didn’t -

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: - Bullshit. You looked right at me. He gives her a look, a little smile.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Seeing my favorite band. I asked how you were.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: No. They’re not allowed to be your favorite band!

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: We're not five. We can like the same band.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: No, we can’t. I refuse to have that in common with you. How did I not know this?

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: I guess we were... distracted.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: I can’t do this. She moves to go. He steps in her way.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: I... think about you. I miss you.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: (beat, a nod) I know. I miss me too.  107 108 76.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: I guess it just takes time. Just then, a PRETTY GIRL (not slutty, but hot ina forgettable way) pokes her head out of the auditorium.

dialogues.speaker: PRETTY GIRL
dialogues.text: Marco! There you are! Rosie quickly sizes up the situation.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Really? How much time, Marco? As the Pretty Girl approaches, Rosie turns and walks back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Arcade Fire rocks everyone’s faces off, Rosie just stands there, stage lights washing over her. Five rows back, Marco keeps glancing at her. His Pretty D looks bored, texting on her phone. The BLUE LIGHTS of the stage DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The morning sky. An unshaven Nate waits for Vic, Craig, G and Patel and their babies (Haskel now on crutches). But guys all pass Nate up in stone-cold silence.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Guys, whoa. Wait up. Nate hustles to keep up. When Vic spins back - vic - Don’t take another step.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I don’t unders- What’s going on? vic You broke the code, Nate. You told your wife that Craig likes to call Henri, Henry.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: And she did not take it well.  109 109pt the vic We’re here to let off a little steam. Not break-up families.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m sorry, Craig, I didn’t even think about that. Nate moves to join them -

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: I may have an infant strapped to me, but that doesn’t mean I won’t punch you in the face. Cause I will.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: C’mon. I’m in crisis here. We’re about about to have a baby and we're not even speaking. How do you handle that one? vic No, Nate. How do you handle it? They walk off, abandoning him. Gabe looks back -

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: And I want that RUN DMC onesie I gave you back!

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Don’t punish my kid for my mistakes. He’s gonna crush that onesie! Davis jogs by, shaking his head -

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Hang in there, Bro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules, even bigger now, exhausted, falls into bed. She tu on the TV. She looks sad to see - ON TV, Celebrity Dance Off - Evan stands with Wanda Sykes a cheeky Hutch Davis, who declares -  110 111 78.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH DAVIS
dialogues.text: --- So, tune in next week to see Wanda and Evan dance to the Bryan Adams’ classic, Cuts Like Knife. Everyone LAUGHS. Evan grits his teeth as we PULL OUT of..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bar TV to find the girls from Rosie’s apartment all watching and weighing in.

dialogues.speaker: COURTNEY
dialogues.text: I would do an uncircumcised guy. I just wouldn’t go down on him.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: You don’t know what you’re missing. I blew my way through Europe. Ciao, Italia. The girls just look at Molly, laugh, shake their heads.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ATLANTA OFFICE PARK — LUNCH TIME - DAY 111 Jules, more exhausted but trying to rally, briskly waddle CAMERA CREW in tow. She whispers to camera -

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: OK, here we are in Atlanta, Georgia. Home of one of our audience favorites from Season Four, we’re going to see how he’s maintaining his weight and his healthy lifestyle. C’mon - Jules sneaks around to - THE BIG PIG TRUCK, lunch time in another office park as J lays eyes on her target.

dialogues.speaker: JULES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You! Drop the Taco! Someone turns and it’s... Colin who jumps when he sees Ju

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Aargh! Jules! Hi, I, uh -  Tr. Colin realizes he’s being filmed. Jules takes his lunch a starts inspecting it -

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: OK, Mr. Cooper, let’s see, what we have here... High fat, high carbs. Colin, Colin, Colin. Don’t you remember this guy? Jules holds up a PHOTO of the old FAT COLIN from when he a contestant on ‘Lose It And Weep’. He’s unrecognizable i his fat-dude goatee. Colin shudders. JULES (CONT’D) You don’t want to go back to that, do you?

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: No. Jules, this is just a one-time thing.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Really? Because we've been doing some recon for a little while now, Colin - Jules shows him surveillance photos of him secretly hitti the food trucks. Colin starts to get a little defensive -

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: - I'm just... My wife is pregnant and, as you probably know, Jules, it is very common for male partners to put a little weight on too. It’s actually called “Couvade Syndrome” or “Sympathetic Pregnancy.” The term "couvade" is borrowed from the French verb “couver”, to brood or to hatch -

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: - Colin, shut up. That’s a crutch. (a beat) What’s the real issue, Colin? Because you have to deal with that today, not a hundred pounds from now. Colin nods, starting to get a little emotional.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: I know. It’s just... I didn’t expect pregnancy would bring up all my childhood issues.  80.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I know, it’s like, suddenly, because you have this belly everyone gets to have an opinion about your baby, and before you know it, this blessed miracle that you didn’t even think could happen is reduced to one big penis joke. And hey - I like penis jokes as much as the next girl, but someone - anyone - just ask me a about the name and what I’m craving! Colin just stares at her. Jules stops. Then -

dialogues.speaker: JULES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right. And so we’re gonna deal with this in a healthy way, right, Colin? (Colin slowly nods) Say ‘I’m worth it.’

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: I’m worth it!

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Say ‘I can do this!’

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: There you go. Now let’s do a few lunges, right now, you and me. Colin nods and starts lunging. Jules lunges, but now she’ pregnant, she goes down... and can’t get back up -

dialogues.speaker: JULES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: OK. I’m gonna need a little help. The crew rushes in to help Jules up. But she suddenly win in fierce pain.

dialogues.speaker: JULES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t touch me!

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: We need a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a large hotel suite, Jules now sits in bed as an OLDER DOCTOR checks her blood pressure. She looks miserable and scared.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: You’re on full bedrest for the next two weeks. (pats her leg) Get ready to have this baby in Atlanta.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Wait, what!? I have to stay here!?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Yes -

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: - But, not like in bed the whole time?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Yes. And if you don’t, you could lose this baby. Terror washes over Jules's face. DOCTOR (CONT’D) Now, who can come and take care of you? Jules looks scared and overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. BUCKHEAD ESTATE —- DAY lal} Colin, carrying a pink present, helps Trish (larger now) the door. She clutches a Costco-size bottle of Tums and t move at a snail’s pace.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Slow down, Colin! You're practically sprinting!

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: (slowing) OK, okay. (then) Squeaks, you sure you feel alright?  82.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Quit asking me that! I’m great! They reach the door, RING THE BELL. Colin is suddenly hit

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Sweet bird of christ, what is that smell? Is that...you?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: If you have to know, it’s our child! Our child who has gas, okay?! The poor little thing can’t help it!

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Kinda smelt like you, actually...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Don’t you dare talk to our baby that way! I - Trish suddenly stops. Looks down. Then, eerily calm -

dialogues.speaker: TRISH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: - Our baby just peed itself again.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: It’s... okay, honey. It’s okay. (then, gently) Do you think maybe speaking at the La Leche Conference next week might not be the best idea?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (screaming like a lunatic) I need your support! As the door opens and there’s Ramsey -

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY
dialogues.text: Well, look who made it! Aw, your step-mom will be so excited. C’mon on in. You too, Colin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is packed, full barbecue party vibe. Two inflatable, pink Mini Coopers float in the pool. Margaritaville is in full effect, complete with the real- Jimmy Buffet playing the party. Ramsey nods -  83.

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY
dialogues.text: Hey J.B. Skyler, in a cute pregnancy bikini, hangs with her FRIEND near the pool, all getting pedicures. She waves Trish ove

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Trish! Foot massages and pedicures! Trish brightens - she could use a foot massage - and wadd over with her TUMS. Trish plops in a chair, sticks her feet out. They are hug fat compared to Skyler’s little feet. Ramsey watches Trish, then smiles playfully to Colin -

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY
dialogues.text: You sure Trish isn’t having twins? (off Colin's look) Whoa, hey. Just kidding. Ramsey walks off to entertain. Colin looks down at a plat of cupcakes going by. He almost takes one, but walks over Margaritaville instead - RAMSEY'S FRIENDS (50-something retired guys who also favo the Tommy Bahama look) crowd around the bar. RAMSEY’S FRIEND We saw you on that ‘Lose It’ show. My wife and I cried every pound you lost. Don’t gain it back.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: I'm working on it. Colin gets a drink as Ramsey slaps him on the back. Then RAMSEY’S FRIEND #2 So, what’s it like to be the son of a famous racing legend? Do you ever get on the track with this guy?

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY
dialogues.text: One time. The Great Go-Kart Beatdown of ‘89.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Dad, they don’t want to hear -

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY
dialogues.text: - I won. He couldn’t take it.  84.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: He cheated. He started telling me I had a bad tire, waving for me to pull over. Then when I slowed down, he sped past me.

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY
dialogues.text: Just a little lesson in gamesmanship. (Colin quietly seethes) It’s like I told you your whole life, Col. The old man’s always gonna be numero uno. But hey, numero dos ain’t bad either.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: No, Dad. You haven’t told me that my whole life. Because you weren’t there. You just show up and throw money around. But Mom did the work. Colin gets up, starts walking off, leaving his drink.

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY
dialogues.text: What are you doing, Son? You don’t walk away from a fresh margarita.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: I’m not supposed to drink my calories! And I need some air. As Colin crosses the party, he sees Trish on the other si of the pool, eyes closed in bliss as she gets a foot mass Colin keeps walking, exiting the backyard to the golf cou and some peace. He looks at Ramsey’s parked golf carts.

dialogues.speaker: BACK WITH RAMSEY
dialogues.text: He shakes his head, letting Colin go. Then turns to find himself face-to-face with Skyler, who’s had enough.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Ramsey Cooper, you put your drink down and get your ass out there and fix what needs fixing. Now.

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY
dialogues.text: Aw c’mon, Tater Tot -

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: - I will not bring these babies into this world while there is strife in this family.  115 116 85. Skyler isn’t fucking around. Even Jimmy Buffet gives Rams look. Ramsey sighs, then gets going. Skyler smiles.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BUCKHEAD GOLF COURSE
dialogues.text: Colin cruises in a golf cart, clearing his mind, enjoying fairway, talking himself through his emotions -

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: It’s OK... You’ll just do it different. You will not ridicule, you will not compete, you will not confuse money for a relationship...

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: COLIN! Hey! Colin turns back and sees Ramsey riding his own golf cart trying to catch up. Colin calls back.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: I want some alone time, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY
dialogues.text: Aw, c’mon. I was just messing with ya. I didn’t know you were so mad. Colin speeds up. Ramsey gets close. Colin speeds up more. Ramsey smiles, he can’t help himself. RAMSEY (CONT’D) Oh, don’t try to game me. You forget who you’re dealing with. And, at that moment - something IGNITES in Colin's mind - HE HEARS RACE CARS REVVING. Colin looks back, gives Ramse look. Then HITS THE GAS and takes off in his golf cart. RAMSEY (CONT’D) Really? You want a little re-match? OK, boy, start your engine. Ramsey laughs, then speeds off after him. 116 Colin and Ramsey tear through the golf course, weaving in out of other carts, laying waste to the fairway. Ramsey catches up, closing in... Colin looks back, shouti  117 86.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: I’m sick of competing with you!

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY
dialogues.text: (getting closer) But hey, it got you on TV. And I watched every episode of your season. I got the whole thing on DVD. Sometimes I stay up nights and watch it again.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: (slowing down) You do? Ramsey smiles, speeding up. His old tricks.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s not going to work this time. And you're not allowed to mention the go-Kart cheat-fest anymore.

dialogues.speaker: RAMSEY
dialogues.text: (pulling even) Fine. You beat me back to the house and I'll never bring it up again. Ramsey takes off, getting the jump. Colin right behind hi The house is in the distance, Jimmy Buffet playing. Peopl from the party start to look up as - Two golf carts speed their direction - NASCAR style - fro the fairway. Ramsey’s ahead. Then Colin... Then Ramsey... Ramsey swerves, tries to knock Colin’s cart into a sandtr But Colin deftly maneuvers away, now taking the lead. Colin’s closing in on home, coming up an embankment. He l back at Ramsey one final time, Colin hits the curb and launches his golf cart into the air... Over the cart path... towards the backyard... Just missing Jimmy Buffet and CRASHING INTO MARGARITAVILL Everyone is stunned silent. Then - RAMSEY’S GOLFING BUDDY Holy shit. He took out Margaritaville.  87.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: (beat, smile) Victory. ACROSS THE PARTY, Trish is asleep in a lounge chair, droo down her chin, clutching her Tums. She didn’t even hear i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Evan rushes in, dropping his luggage. miserable Jules, looks up - relief washes over her face.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: You were right, you win -

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: I don’t want to win. I just want you and the baby safe. Whatever you need, I’m here.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: But what about the show? You have to go back.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: No, I don’t. (a look) Wanda and I got voted off. We had an unfortunate fall during our Cha- cha. Len called it a “national disaster”. Jules stops, gives him a look. Tears suddenly welling.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: You... threw your Cha-cha for me? Evan pulls Jules into a hug.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: I’m not letting anyone else take care of you. That’s my job. (beat) And Jules, I don’t care about any of the other stuff. It doesn’t matter whether we circumcise him. It doesn’t matter whether we name him Jackson. I don’t care, do you?

dialogues.speaker: CUT
dialogues.text: 119 88. EXT. ATLANTA STREETS - LATE NIGHT abate) Food trucks pull away after a late night. Rosie walks to car to find Marco waiting for her. His hands are bandaged he’s holding a TIN BOX. Rosie stops. They both stare at each other for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: If you want me to go, I‘1l go.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: What happened to your hands?

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: (a look, then) I just want you to know that I get it. There’s no way I'll ever really understand what you went through.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I don’t think you can.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: But... I don’t want that to be the reason we‘re not together. You were right, I never took you out ona real date. I want to. (beat) These are for you. Caramels. He hands her the tin. She looks at his bandaged hands.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Piece-of-shit double boiler.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: I thought you said never again.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: I made an exception. Rosie looks at the tin. Sighs.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Marco. The reason we're not together has nothing to do with the fact we were going to have a baby. (beat) It wouldn't have worked out anyway. Marco just looks at her. Hurt, then defiant.  89.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Give me one reason.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: OK, fine. You don’t have a car -

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: - Said the girl with the duct-taped Neon. Seriously, am I the only one who finds the fact that that thing even has an alarm, hilarious?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: I bought it myself, so shut up!

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Well, next time, save a few bucks and just skip the alarm -

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: - And you know what else, you have the worst taste in girls. Honestly, every time I see you all macking around your truck, it’s with the most-obvious, least-interesting, chef groupies ever. How could you be into me if you’re into that?

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Well, Rosie, they can’t all be you. He gives her a look.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Marco. We weren’t meant to be. We were just “an almost.” Rosie tries to hand the caramels back. Marco, stung, does take the caramels.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: No. Keep them. I made them for you. Hurt, Marco gets on his bike and pedals away. The SOUND o his wheels turning, become...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of a crazy humming inside Trish's head. She loo AWFUL, wandering around with a “Taxi Driver" vibe. She sc all the booths: Nipple cream, breast pads and Boppy pillo Everyone else is glowy and smiley.  121 90. Trish’s POV, SHOTS OF: babies and baby paraphernalia (we start to hear the music from “Psycho”) . Trish is snapped out of it by:

dialogues.speaker: ENTHUSIASTIC WOMAN
dialogues.text: There you are, Trish! And looking so fantastic!... Trish turns to see an ENTHUSIASTIC WOMAN (50) approach. She reaches for Trish’s belly. ENTHUSIASTIC WOMAN (CONT’D) We’re so glad you agreed to speak. Are you loving it? Finally experiencing it yourself? You must be ecstatic every second of every day!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (barely together) Every second. Every day. Total ecstasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trish sits on a stage with other women, a FROZEN smile on face. A SCREEN displays: ‘TRISH COOPER OF THE BREAST CHOI The Enthusiastic Woman stands at a podium.

dialogues.speaker: ENTHUSIASTIC WOMAN
dialogues.text: Ladies and babies... Trish Cooper, owner and creator of The Breast Choice! The audience applauds. Trish rises slowly. She blinks int the BRIGHT LIGHT, makes her way to the podium, a weird sm plastered on her face. The audience settles, waits for Tr to start talking. Nothing. ENTHUSIASTIC WOMAN (CONT’D) (whispering) Trish, honey... go ahead. Trish shakes her head “no”, in a trance, completely froze ENTHUSIASTIC WOMAN (CONT’D) Trish... just speak your heart.  O.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Heart? You mean heartburn? Because I have it constantly. Johnny Cash was right - it burns burns burns. The audience shifts, a few chuckles, mostly confusion.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve peed myself twice today and cried four times. Plus, I fart like a frat-boy. I just farted right now. Now the audience starts to squirm.

dialogues.speaker: ENTHUSIASTIC WOMAN
dialogues.text: Oof. She sure did.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Before I got pregnant, I didn’t think about any of this. There were no ugly babies. LIE. They’re everywhere. Hideous, little space alien babies. I’m looking at a few right now. The audience GASPS. Some get up and leave.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m sorry. You ENJOY being sick and getting fat? How about varicose veins? Hemorrhoids? We see shock from the audience. Trish is on a roll now.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All I wanted was to be pregnant, to experience the miracle - the glow. But it’s nothing like I expected. (then) Instead of a glow, I have zits, nipples you could find on Google Earth, and I walk like I’ve been gang-raped.

dialogues.speaker: AUDIENCE MEMBER
dialogues.text: Someone stop her!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s right. I said GANG-

dialogues.speaker: RAPED
dialogues.text: The Enthusiastic Woman gets up to lead Trish off the podi Trish gives her the hand.  122 123 92. The Enthusiastic Woman stops momentarily, unsure of what Trish will do next. Long beat. Trish takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (eerily calm) So... I had a speech. Umm obviously I forgot to print it. I forget everything now. So thanks everybody. This has been a real treat. (beat) I’m Trish Cooper. Come visit me anytime at The Breast Choice on 1401 Peach Tree Lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREEZE on video of this speech. INT. HOME OFFICE, TRISH AND COLIN’S HOUSE - NIGHT 122 Colin has paused You Tube on their computer. Trish sits n to him. Colin’s flabbergasted, but plays it cool.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Nooo. You didn’t go too far at all. I’m sure no one will even see this. The You Tube hits counter climbs at a very fast rate - 3, 4,523, 9,118. Trish points to the tracker. Horrified -

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: This is going to kill my business. I’m more popular than porn! Colin quickly shuts the window.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: I dunno about that. Porn’s pretty popular. But I’m sure this will all blow over in a few days. No doubt. He gives a reassuring smile, leads Trish out of the room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly pushes open the door the twins’ completed nursery. huge, a lot of pink (of course), but chic. Skyler hugs Ho

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: I love it! (then, covertly) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And when you get back from Africa, we'll have to get you started on the rest of the house. Holly lights up, a little surge of confidence.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I’m sure I can squeeze you in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin drives a sullen Trish to work, they pull into strip mall.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Hold your head high.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I can’t.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Well then, just prop it up on your boobs. You’ve got room. Trish smiles weakly at the encouragement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin and Trish are shocked to see a LINE OF WOMEN outsid the store as they pull around back to park. All expectant mothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Colin and Trish enter from the back of the store, Jani runs up.

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: Two million hits! And you have to hear this... Janice hits PLAY on a LAPTOP. And MUSIC STARTS - someone done a catchy AUTO-TUNE dance mix of Trish’s speech.

dialogues.speaker: AUTO TUNE DANCE MIX
dialogues.text: Space Alien Babies/ Space Alien Babies/ Where's my freakin' glow? Janice hippie dances way off the beat, but it’s a sweet j Even Colin bobs his head a little as Janice unlocks the f door and...  127 127pt 128 94. The women flood in, push Colin aside and MOB Trish, thank her for her honesty. Asking all kinds of questions. Beaming, Trish stops for a moment, looks for Colin. He gi her a proud smile as he backs out of the store with a wav She smiles wide and waves back. PRE LAP: The “Home” song starts to play - the jaunty, whistling, opening and the music playing over - THE AIRLINE COMMERCIAL Nate worked on. lav We follow a suitcase, making its journey through an airport...

dialogues.speaker: AIRLINE COMMERCIAL MUSIC
dialogues.text: Home, let me come home home home/ home is wherever I'm with you... Sliding down a BAGGAGE CAROUSEL where a BUSINESS GUY anxiously waits, reaches down to grab his bag, when - A SMALL HAND - reaches for the same bag. Pull out to reve LITTLE BOY looking at his dad, helping him carry his bag. As the music continues and... PULL OUT from an AIRPORT TERMINAL TV SCREEN playing the a outside an ETHIOPIAN AIRLINES GATE, as we PICK UP Nate an Holly walking through the gangplank into the terminal. Outside, the dusty, sunny chaos of Africa. Nate and Holly look exhausted and tense, things aren’t resolved yet.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Who does that? Who sits on a flight for 17 hours and doesn’t speak?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Let’s see, 8 hours for sleeping and, oh yeah - you’re the one not talking to me.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I should’ve just come by myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smiling AGENCY OFFICIAL holds up a CHRISTIAN WORLD ADOP sign -

A group of BEAMING ADOPTIVE COUPLES (about 12) are alread there. Most of them look very buttoned up, very conservat Perfect, happy. As miserable Nate and Holly wrestle with their luggage, p stroller, plus car seat to join them.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Look at them, they look like saints.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: How did we even get chosen for this?

dialogues.speaker: SMILING AGENCY OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: (to Nate and Holly) Welcome to Ethiopia. You ready for the adventure of a lifetime? Nate and Holly force a smile and nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate and Holly ride with their group, leaving the Ethiopi capitol of Addis. They look out at the landscape. Orange earth meets bright blue sky. They pass a man with TWO CAMELS. A fellow adopting COUPLE looks over and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: FELLOW MOM
dialogues.text: Your first time?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Yeah. You?

dialogues.speaker: FELLOW DAD
dialogues.text: Fifth.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: FELLOW MOM
dialogues.text: Once you open that door, it’s hard to close.

dialogues.speaker: FELLOW DAD
dialogues.text: But this is the last one. Really.

dialogues.speaker: FELLOW MOM
dialogues.text: He says that every time.  130 131 96. She takes her husband’s hand. Nate looks at them, feeling as... INT. DOCTOR’S OFFICE - MORNING 130 A miserable Trish, HUGE and ready to burst, sits on an examination table, talking to her DOCTOR.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I’m gonna take this baby out myself, you'll hear about me on the news!

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: You want this baby on time? Start walking now. A lot. EXT. PIEDMONT PARK - DAY i3a Vic, Craig, Gabe and Patel and their respective babies wa

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: --- I’m just saying, Vic, it wasn’t such a bad thing. Even Kara’s calling him Henry now. In a way, I owe Nate. vic Thank you, Craig. The board will take your proposal under consideration. They look up as - Trish, in her Snuggie (her regular uniform now), trailed Colin, power-walks through the park. She barrels past the dudes, nearly taking out Gabe and Patel’s strollers. Colin gives them an apologetic look as he tries to keep u with her. Vic just smiles -

dialogues.speaker: VIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can’t get that labor started, huh?

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: You don’t even know.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: Try having sex. That’s the really fun part.  oh. The guys share a knowing look and laugh - they know what term, awkward sex is like. Vic calls after Colin. vic We're here every Saturday. Then -

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: vic! vic! Vic and the guys turns to see a stricken Davis pacing by pull-up bar. Davis runs to Vic.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Vic, man. We gotta talk.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: (seriously concerned) You’re not gonna do your pull-ups? vic Davis. Man, everything OK?

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Remember that girl from Australia? The one who surfs?

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: Ah yes. “Abbie, short for Abigail”. I remember her well. Excellent photos, Davis. Very artful.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS

dialogues.text: Rosie. Hey.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? J.J. Homeboy ran over my foot. Marco shrugs, nods. Rosie starts to laugh, she can’t help

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Sorry. I don’t mean to laugh. J.J. Nah, it’s OK. It’s funny. (to Marco) Hey. Meet you in the truck. He crutches off, leaving Marco and Rosie.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?  183 184 118.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: My aunt, she married this crazy old dude - they just had twins. I was gonna go see them - She stops. Gives him a look -

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You wouldn’t wanna...? (beat) Is that weird?

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: It’s a little weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco and Rosie stand looking at Skyler’s twins. All the babies are amazing. Then —

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: You OK?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know I’1l get another chance. When it’s right.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: You will. Then -

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Those caramels were delicious.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Never again. Rosie laughs. They stand there a beat. Then slooooowly, R inches her way closer to Marco. She reaches for his hand and takes it. She doesn’t let go And MUSIC CRANKS as we pull away... out of the corridor.. out the hospital...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: Three windows, through which we see:  185 Ti... Jules and Evan with their baby; Trish and Colin kissing t baby; Skyler and Ramsey with their twins, who start to cr Music carries us back to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate, Holly and Kaleb, now rocking his RUN DMC onesie, ar with all the other new parents and babies at the airport. Holly is trying like mad to console a BAWLING Kaleb. Several of the other babies are crying too. Holly’s exasperated. Nate jumps in.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Here, let me try. He takes Kaleb. Not too sure of what to do, then -— NATE (CONT’D) .--OK, what about this one - (quietly rapping) I like big butts and I cannot lie/ you other brothers can't deny/ that when a girl walks in with an itty bitty waist and a round thing in your face - - One of the Moms shoots Nate a sharp look, he stops - NATE (CONT’D) (whispers to Kaleb) OK, I‘1l teach you that one later. Nate, then slowly starts to whistle the intro of the “Hom song. Kaleb suddenly stops, perks right up - NATE (CONT’D) Oh you like that, do you? (singing it now) Atlanta, Georgia, Arkansas/ I do love my Ma and Pa/ But, not the way that I do love you - Holly perks up and joins in -

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Well, Holy-moly, me oh my/ you're the apple of my eye/ Boy, I never loved one like you - Another Mom perks up -  186 187 188 189 190 120.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER MOM
dialogues.text: Oh! I love that song! She starts singing too, to her baby.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, HOLLY AND OTHER MOM
dialogues.text: Home/ Let me come home home home/ Home is wherever I'm with you - Nate smiles as another Dad now joins in too -

dialogues.speaker: NATE, OTHER MOM, AND DAD
dialogues.text: Oh, Home/ yes I am home home home - And slowly everyone joins in - there at the terminal, all the babies quieting down. Kaleb smiles, then reaches out touches Nate’s hair. Nate beams -

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: - Home is whenever I'm with you... As we move out of the terminal and leave them to their journey home.

dialogues.speaker: OVER END TITLES
dialogues.text: Button: At BAGGAGE CLAIM, Davis holds a stuffed elephant passengers arrive from an Australian flight. He looks pas the various kids stepping off the plane when, he spots - Little RUBY, a two-year-old demon child, trailed by her v pretty, but very exhausted mother, ABBIE (late 20s). Davi gives them a look, lets out a terrified smile. Button: At hospital parking, Trish waits in a wheelchair, breast-feeding baby Theo as Colin wrestles and wrestles w the car seat nearby. Trish looks at group of PREGNANT COU arriving for their hospital tour. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Just get the epidural. Button: At a fine restaurant, Marco and Rosie, dressed fo first date, make their way to a table. He pulls out the c for her. She rolls her eyes, but loves it. Button: Nate and Holly tuck Kaleb into his new nursery th used to be Nate’s studio. But the wall of framed albums i still up. Including the framed 2 Live Crew album. Button: 3:00 AM. Agonizing baby cries. An exhausted Skyle and Ramsey frantically try to soothe their colicky twins. 186 187 188 189 190  191 192 Tey... The beautiful nursery is a wreck and so is Skyler. With t up in her hair. She looks like hell and she’s sobbing -

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: I didn’t expect it to be this hard! Button: Piedmont Park. Dude walk is back on. Vic, Craig, Gabe, Patel, Nate and new members Davis (looking a little fatter and unshaven) and Colin (proudly wearing a baby sling). They look up as - A mint CLASSIC 70’s AIRBRUSHED VAN (wizards and dragons a shit painted on the side) pulls into the parking lot. The doors slide open and out steps Patel. We see the interior the van tricked out with multiple car seats, a crib anda changing table. They CHEER, then... Walk, all stumbling their way through fatherhood with Atlanta’s skyline and Patel’s van behind them. Button: BACK IN LOS ANGELES - Lights, mirrored ball and a house band plays as Jules and Evan do a Celebrity Dance O style samba. PULL BACK TO REVEAL: They’re not on the show. It’s their WEDDING and this is their first dance. Off to the side, wedding guest Hutch Davis holds baby Emmerson, who spits up on him. It’s awful. But it’s so beautiful.
